intro: Stichorkis mieczyslawiana, commonly known as the Mieczysławian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian region. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
